Content: Short title, extent, and commencement. Repealed by Repealing and Amending Act, 1945.
Definitions: (a) 'arbitration agreement', (b) 'award', (c) 'Court', (d) 'legal representative', (e) 'reference'.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Provisions implied in arbitration agreement (as per First Schedule) unless otherwise expressed.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Agreement for arbitrator appointment by a third party.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Authority of arbitrator/umpire irrevocable except by Court’s leave.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Arbitration agreement not discharged by death of a party; enforceable against legal representatives.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Provisions in insolvency: arbitration terms enforceable if receiver adopts the contract.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court’s power to appoint arbitrator/umpire if parties fail to concur or vacancies arise.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Appointment of new arbitrator/sole arbitrator if one party defaults.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Rules for three or more arbitrators: majority award or umpire’s decision prevails.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court may remove arbitrator/umpire for delay/misconduct; no remuneration if removed.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court’s power to fill vacancies after removal/revocation of arbitrator’s authority.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Arbitrator’s powers: administer oaths, state special cases, correct clerical errors, etc.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Procedure for signing, filing, and notifying parties of the award.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court may modify/correct awards for matters not referred, imperfections, or clerical errors.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court may remit award for reconsideration if undetermined/indeterminate or legality objections.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Judgment in terms of award; decree follows with limited appeal grounds.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court’s power to pass interim orders to prevent obstruction of award execution.

Part: Arbitration Without Intervention Of A Court
Content: Court may supersede arbitration if award becomes void/set aside.

Part: Arbitration With Intervention Of A Court
Content: Application to file arbitration agreement in Court; procedure for reference.
Parties to suit may apply for reference to arbitration before judgment.
Manner of arbitrator appointment as agreed by parties.
Court specifies time for award; restricts Court’s interference post-reference.
Partial reference to arbitration if separable; suit continues for non-joining parties.
Provisions of other chapters apply; Court may supersede arbitration in specified cases.
Chapter V applies to all arbitrations unless otherwise provided.
Arbitrators may make interim awards unless agreement states otherwise.
Court may extend time for making award; contractual time-extension clauses void.
Court may order interest on awarded money from decree date.
Grounds for setting aside award: misconduct, invalidity, or improper procurement.
Jurisdiction: award filed in relevant Court; exclusive jurisdiction over validity questions.
Bar on suits contesting arbitration agreements/awards; remedies limited to Act’s provisions.
Contesting arbitration agreement/award via Court application; evidence procedures.
Stay of legal proceedings if arbitration agreement exists; applicant must be ready for arbitration.
Legal proceedings do not invalidate reference/award unless proceedings cover entire subject matter.
Court may negate award-as-precondition clauses if agreement ceases to apply.
Limitation Act applies to arbitrations; deemed commencement of arbitration.
Disputes over arbitrator’s fees/costs: Court may order payment and refund balance.
Appealable orders: superseding arbitration, modifying awards, staying proceedings, etc. No second appeal.
Small Cause Court jurisdiction limited to specific applications.
Code of Civil Procedure applies; Court’s powers mirror Second Schedule.
Service of notices via delivery/post if no agreement provision.
Court processes for witness/party appearance; penalties for non-compliance.
High Court’s rule-making authority for arbitration procedures.
Act binding on Government.
Application to statutory arbitrations, excluding specific sections.
Act applies to all arbitrations unless inconsistent with other laws.
Savings for pending references pre-commencement of Act.
Repeals and amendments (repealed by 1945 Act).
Implied conditions: sole arbitrator, time limits for awards, finality of awards, cost discretion, etc.
